mdRecord.dcterms:title: Nova Virginiae tabula
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Hondius, Hendrik, 1597-1651 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Described as "Derivative 5, State 1" of John Smith's map of Virginia. It was used in all editions of the Mercator-Hondius atlas published after 1633, according to Verner, cited below. [original]
Variant 1: Dutch text on verso, with signature Iii, catchword "is" On sheet 44 x 54 cm. Annotated in pencil, "Jansson, 1650." [original]
Variant 2: Dutch text on verso, with signature Dd, catchword "riviere." On sheet 50 x 54 cm. Annotated in pencil, "Janson, Amsterdam, 1658." [original]
Oriented with north to the right. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: G3880 1633 .H6 1650: Variant 1. Paul Mellon Bequest, May 12, 2000. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: G3880 1633 .H6 1658: Variant 2. Paul Mellon Bequest, May 12, 2000. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mellon, Paul--Library--Personal copy
Virginia--Maps--Early works to 1800
